sentences.en: But inherent in this boom were the seeds of economic disaster.
sentences.cn: 然而在这种繁荣的背后却隐藏着经济危机的祸根.

sentences.en: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.cn: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.en: He has an inherent love of beauty.
I think racism is unconsciously inherent in practically everyone.
sentences.cn: 我认为种族偏见固有地存在于几乎所有人的潜意识中。

sentences.en: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.cn: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

sentences.en: Individuality is a valued and inherent part of the British character.
sentences.cn: 个性鲜明是英国人固有的、也是他们看重的特点。

sentences.en: Inherent in judicial review are many functional limitations.
sentences.cn: 司法审查本身带有许多固有的职能限制.

sentences.en: Mainline feminism was arguing for the inherent beauty of the natural woman.
sentences.cn: 主流女权主义思想倡导女性天生的自然美。

sentences.en: Nevertheless the dangers inherent in the machine are still there.
sentences.cn: 尽管如此,机器所固有的危险仍旧存在.

sentences.en: Polarity is inherent in a magnet.
sentences.cn: 极性是磁铁的固有性质.

sentences.en: Stress is an inherent part of dieting.
The desire for freedom is inherent in us all.
sentences.cn: 对自由的渴望是我们所有人的天性.

sentences.en: the difficulties inherent in a study of this type
The paradox inherent in this situation is easy to state.
sentences.cn: 在这种情形中固有的自相矛盾之处显而易见.

sentences.en: There is inherent persuasiveness in some voices.
sentences.cn: 有些人的声音天生具有一种说服力.

sentences.en: These are inherent and apparently permanent and can be propagated vegetatively.
sentences.cn: 这些具有内在的和明显的遗传性,并可以无性繁殖.

sentences.en: Weight is an inherent property of matter.
sentences.cn: 重量是物质固有的特性.

words.tran_cn: 遗传的；继承权的；通过继承得到的
继承；经遗传而得（inherit的过去分词）
固有；生来即存在；本质上即属

phrases.tran_cn: 内在水分，固有水分；内在潮湿；结构水
固有变动率；内不等率；自行调节；自平衡
固有可靠性；本质可靠性
比浓对数粘度；特性黏度

trans.tran_en: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it
